org.jlab.coda.et

Class EtSystemOpen

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.et.EtSystemOpen

  • public class EtSystemOpen
extends java.lang.Object
    This class opens (finds and connects to) an ET system. The use of this class is hidden from the user. There is no reason to use it explicitly.
    Author:
    Carl Timmer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EtSystemOpen(EtSystemOpenConfig config)
      Constructor which stores copy of argument.

      Gets all port numbers when multiple ET systems respond.

      Gets list of all the IP addresses (dot decimal) of the host the opened ET system is running on.

      Gets the object used to access native methods when using local, C-based ET system.

      Gets the language used to implement the opened ET system.

      Gets the local address (dot decimal) used to connect to ET system.

      Gets the number of station select integers of the opened ET system.

      Gets whether a local, C-based ET system was opened and a JNI library was used to access events directly instead of over sockets.

        public void setDebug(int debug)
              throws org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException
        Sets the debug output level. Must be either EtConstants.debugNone, EtConstants.debugSevere, EtConstants.debugError, EtConstants.debugWarn, or EtConstants.debugInfo.
        Parameters:
        debug - debug level
        Throws:
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if bad argument value

        public boolean usingJniLibrary()
        Gets whether a local, C-based ET system was opened and a JNI library was used to access events directly instead of over sockets.
        Returns:
        true if opening a local, C-based ET system and using JNI library to access events.

      • getAllHosts

      • getAllPorts

        public int[] getAllPorts()
        Gets all port numbers when multiple ET systems respond.
        Returns:
        all port numbers from responding ET systems

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException,
                    org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTooManyException
        Creates a connection to an ET system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if problems with network communications; if the host address(es) is(are) unknown
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtException - if the responding ET system has the wrong name, runs a different version of ET, or has a different value for EtConstants.stationSelectInts
        org.jlab.coda.et.exception.EtTooManyException - if there were more than one valid response when policy is set to EtConstants.policyError and we are looking either remotely or anywhere for the ET system.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from the ET system server.
